sentences.sContent: I didn’t recognize you in your uniform.
sentences.sCn: 你穿上制服我认不出你了。

sentences.sContent: It was malaria, but Dr Lee hadn’t recognized the symptoms.
sentences.sCn: 这是疟疾，但李医生没有认出症状。

sentences.sContent: ...Great leaders recognize the weak signals or slight signs that point to big changes to come...
...They can recognize power and know how to use it...
...Almost all companies recognize the importance of innovation today...
...it is to recognize that in America's vast criminal justice system...
...Lee Institute for Health Policy Studies: “We recognize that there are cultural and celebratory aspects of sugar...
...I think she’s beginning to recognize that she contributes as much to our friendship...
...to recognize the significance of the act...
...He criticized teachers for failing to recognize that boys are actually more emotional than girls...

remMethod.val: re ＋ cogni(s)(知道) ＋ ze → 认出； 承认

words.tran: 可辨认的；可认识的；可承认的
识别；承认，认出；重视；赞誉；公认
认识；意识到（recogniz的过去分词）
承认；认出；辨别（recognise的过去分词）

trans.tranCn: 认出， 识别； 承认； 赏识， 表彰， 报偿
trans.tranOther: to know who someone is or what something is, because you have seen, heard, experienced, or learned about them in the past
